alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued March 03 at 9:40AM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible. * WHERE...Erie County. * WHEN...From 1 PM EST this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East to northeast gales of around 35 knots with gusts of 45 to 50 knots and waves of 6 to 11 feet are anticipated in the western basin of Lake Erie this afternoon and evening. Water levels may rise in response, with the highest lakeshore flooding risk on Kelleys Island.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
